reviews.text: Comfortable stay and good value for money. Quiet residentia area. Two minutes to all amenities in Golders Green. 5 mins from the tube and 20 minutes (tube) to central London.
reviews.title: Marcel guest house

reviews.text: I absolutely loved staying here. The while atmosphere of the b&b made me feel at home. The neighborhood was nice and quiet, yet we were 6 minutes away from the tube. Plenty of choices to eat just around the corner.
reviews.title: Awesome place to stay at.

reviews.text: Very hospitable, rooms clean comfortable with every facility in good working condition including a/c -it was very hot suorisingly. The area is quiet and full English breakfast was very good. Five minute walking distance from unferground about 20 minute ride to centre
reviews.title: Excellent value for money in an expensive capital city

reviews.text: We stayed in Martel Guest Hous for 4 nights beautiful and clean room, good facilieties, Phil prepared every day a fantastic breakfast for us!!! Nice, very nice. I recommend this accomodation, the best I've found in London!
reviews.title: The Best in London

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here 3 nights over a weekend. Conveniently close to M1 and Golders Green tube station. Our Compact Double room although cosy was clean and quiet and the breakfast each morning was excellent. Phil and staff very friendly and helpful. Good value for money. All in all a really good stay.
reviews.title: Great Base For Visiting London

reviews.text: We stayed at the Martel Guest House for 4 nights. Our whole family has felt very comfortable there, the rooms were clean with good comfort and the breakfast was excellent. The guesthouse is situated in a beautiful and quiet area and you have a good connection to the subway and the city. If we come back to London, we will certainly stay there again.
reviews.title: wonderful 5 days

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Martel Guest House is situated in North West London, in a nice looking suburb. There is a (free of charge) car park just in front, and although it can only accomodate about 5 cars, you should be able to park there easily enough.
reviews.title: A very relaxed stay awaits you at Martel Guest House

reviews.text: As soon as you ring the bell, a friendly welcome is the first thing you get, and it gets even better when you see your room: very clean, cozy and with a nice bathroom. There's a tv, a fridge you can fill up during your stay, and even free wifi. Didn't bring your laptop? You can even rent one here for only £2 ! The rooms are also very clean. Even if you stay for a couple of nights, it feels you walk into a brand new room every time.
reviews.title: good guest house

reviews.text: In the morning, you go down for your breakfast, which Mr. Martel prepares right away. You can have some cereal, ham and cheese, toast, a complete English Breakfast,... Everything is top notch.
reviews.title: I'll be back

reviews.text: As for tranportation, you're only a 5 minute walk away from Golder's Green station. For those of you who know the London Underground: it's in zone 3 on the Northern Line, about 15 minutes from Leicester Square and thus the centre of London City.
reviews.title: A welcoming place in NW London.

reviews.text: nice breakfast, very clean and confortable room, free parking and nice area.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We'll come back with pleasure.
reviews.title: Martel Guest House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - clean room
reviews.title: Martel Guest House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - very good breakfast
reviews.title: Great, and wonderful stay!

reviews.text: - perfect service
reviews.title: Martel ticks all the boxes

reviews.text: I recently stayed at Martel which was the second occasion I had been there. Again everything was as I had hoped for: clean, warm and a lovely breakfast - made to order and with lots of choice. The beds are firm which suits me fine. I would recommend this B&B to anyone who wants a quiet stay with parking just a short tube journey into London. Also close to good supermarkets so you can bring a bottle to put in your mini fridge after a hard shopping day in the city.
reviews.title: Best of Golders Green

reviews.text: Thanks Phil for coming round to welcome me. Your kind staff gave me a very warm welcome. I find the area most convenient and your Martel Guest House so lovely, thanks. There are buses to all over London from Golders Green, I suggest getting a Buss Pass, cheaper than tube and admire the scenery and the people of London! My room comfy, very clean and coffe/tea facilities. Very nice.
reviews.title: Warm welcome!

reviews.text: We stayed at the Martel Guest House for 5nights. The triple room we had was clean and the beds were very comfortable. Phil prepared breakfast each morning which was excellent. The guesthouse is in a very nice location and you feel very safe walking the few blocks back at the end of the day.Golders Green subway is about 15min from the city making it a very easy trip. We would recommend the Martel Guest house to anyone wanting a relaxing stay in London.
reviews.title: Great Stay at Martel

reviews.text: Family room was clean and comfortable for our family of four visiting over Easter break for 6 nights. Tube station only 3 blocks away which takes you into Central London in under 20 minutes. Our host, Phil Martel, was very welcoming and each morning would make our breakfast to order. Very reasonable for the quality of room and service.
reviews.title: Convenient location to London

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in July 2011. Enjoyed the full English breakfast, with eggs cooked to order. Our room, the breakfast room - both were very clean and well-maintained. An easy walk to the tube station. Golders Green is quite a distance from the heart of London, resulting in a pricier tube fare. However, the inconvenience is balanced by the reasonable price of the room. Few restaurants in the area, so dine in London before returning to the guest house for the night.
reviews.title: Tasty, filling breakfast; clean; reasonable price; quite a distance
